definition: circle/ring/loop/classifier for loops, orbits, laps of race etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to surround/to circle
to confine/to lock up/to pen in
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
rushing to stake one's claim in new markets

sentences.english: You have something on your mind, I think, " said the mattress".
sentences.chinese: “你腦子裏在想些什麼，我覺得，”牀墊慵圈地說。

sentences.english: Thomas H. Brittain, for his support in putting on Rodeo 2011.
sentences.chinese: 托馬斯H布里廷，他在投入上圈地2011的支持。

sentences.english: The settlers were enclosing land and engaged in wars with the Native Americans.
sentences.chinese: 殖民者在圈地，並挑起了與印第安人的戰爭。

sentences.english: It's a "land-grab", says a Chinese executive.
sentences.chinese: 這將是一場“圈地運動”，一位中國的行政官員說道。

sentences.english: Well, the Native Americans, as hunter-gatherers, didn't actually enclose land.
sentences.chinese: 印第安人，作爲採獵者，事實上是沒有圈地。

sentences.english: The enclosures were legitimized by the passage of parliamentary bills.
sentences.chinese: 這種圈地是經議會合法通過的。

sentences.english: These new enclosures also produced new isolated farmsteads.
sentences.chinese: 這些新的圈地也產生了新的分離農場。

sentences.english: It is typical of the enclosure movement is characterized by the forced transfer mode.
sentences.chinese: 它是典型的以圈地運動爲特徵的強制轉移模式。

sentences.english: And unhorsed by fences, laws and alien taboos.
sentences.chinese: 最後被圈地法律和外來清規戒律擊敗。

definition: rushing to stake one's claim in new markets
to blossom everywhere/to spring up all over the place/to flourish on a large scale
to take cities and seize territories (idiom)
military banner/flag signal/(fig.) banner (i.e. false pretenses)
to set up an independent regime/to secede/segmentation/division/fragmentation
